body:
**What happened**:
When using sonobuoy to run some community tests, I realized that ginkgo was not invoked properly. More precisely, when invoking sonobuoy like this:
```
sonobuoy run --wait --kube-conformance-image-version v1.18.0-beta.0 --e2e-focus '\[Feature:NetworkPolicy\]' --e2e-skip '' --e2e-parallel y
```
I saw the following in the sonobuoy logs:
```
Executable path: /usr/local/bin/ginkgo
Args (comma-delimited): /usr/local/bin/ginkgo,--p,--focus=\[Feature:NetworkPolicy\],--skip=[Serial],--noColor=true,/usr/local/bin/e2e.test,--,--disable-log-dump,--repo-root=/kubernetes,--provider=local,--report-dir=/tmp/results,--kubeconfig=,--progress-report-url=http://localhost:8099/progres
```

Because I am running the tests in parallel, and sonobuoy does not set `E2E_SKIP`, the code defaults to `serialTestsRegexp` (see https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/cluster/images/conformance/go-runner/const.go#L66) for `--skip`, and `serialTestsRegexp` is set to `[Serial]`. This is not the intended regex (should be `\[Serial\]`) and all the tests are skipped (because all test names have an `e`).

**What you expected to happen**:
`--skip` should be set to `\[Serial\]` so that only the tests with the `[Serial]` "tag" are skipped.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Use the sonobuoy command provided above.

**Environment**:
`Sonobuoy Version: v0.17.2`

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: defaultFocus and serialTestsRegexp when building ginkgo command for conformance tests are incorrect
